119th CONGRESS
1st SESSION

H.R. 6234

AN ACT
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to expand eligibility for premium tax credits and strengthen health insurance affordability provisions.

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Health Insurance Affordability Improvement Act of 2026".

SEC. 2. FINDINGS AND PURPOSE.
(a) FINDINGS.—Congress finds that—
(1) the premium tax credit under section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has helped millions of Americans obtain affordable health insurance;
(2) rising health care costs continue to strain household budgets;
(3) enhanced coordination between tax credits and cost-sharing reduction programs will improve health insurance affordability;
(4) cross-title amendments are necessary to ensure consistency between the Internal Revenue Code and the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
(b) PURPOSE.—The purpose of this Act is to expand eligibility for premium tax credits and improve coordination of health insurance affordability programs.

SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO PREMIUM TAX CREDITS.
(a) EXPANSION OF CREDIT.—Section 36B of title 26, United States Code, is amended—
(1) in striking in subsection (b)(3)(A)(i) "400 percent" and inserting "500 percent";
(2) by striking subsection (c)(1)(A) and inserting the following:
"(A) APPLICABLE PERCENTAGE.—The applicable percentage for any taxable year shall be determined in accordance with the following table:
"In the case of household income (expressed as a percent of poverty line) within the following income tier:
"Up to 150 percent...........................0.0 percent
"150 percent up to 200 percent...............2.0 percent
"200 percent up to 250 percent...............4.0 percent
"250 percent up to 300 percent...............6.0 percent
"300 percent up to 400 percent...............8.5 percent
"400 percent up to 500 percent...............10.0 percent."; and
(3) by adding at the end of subsection (c) the following new paragraph:
"(6) ENHANCED CREDIT FOR ESSENTIAL WORKERS.—
"(A) IN GENERAL.—In the case of an applicable taxpayer who is an essential worker, the applicable percentage determined under paragraph (1) shall be reduced by 2 percentage points (but not below zero).
"(B) ESSENTIAL WORKER.—For purposes of this paragraph, the term 'essential worker' means an individual who is employed in—
"(i) health care;
"(ii) emergency services;
"(iii) food and agriculture;
"(iv) transportation and logistics; or
"(v) any other sector designated by the Secretary as essential.".

SEC. 4. AMENDMENTS TO COST-SHARING REDUCTION PROGRAM.
Section 18071 of title 42, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
"(g) ENHANCED COST-SHARING REDUCTIONS.—
"(1) IN GENERAL.—For plan years beginning after December 31, 2026, the Secretary shall provide enhanced cost-sharing reductions to eligible insureds.
"(2) ELIGIBLE INSURED.—For purposes of this subsection, an eligible insured is an individual who—
"(A) is enrolled in a qualified health plan through an Exchange;
"(B) has household income that does not exceed 300 percent of the poverty line; and
"(C) is not eligible for minimum essential coverage (other than coverage in the individual market).
"(3) ENHANCED REDUCTION AMOUNTS.—The Secretary shall ensure that the cost-sharing reductions provided under this subsection result in—
"(A) for individuals with household income up to 150 percent of the poverty line, an actuarial value of at least 98 percent;
"(B) for individuals with household income between 150 and 200 percent of the poverty line, an actuarial value of at least 94 percent; and
"(C) for individuals with household income between 200 and 300 percent of the poverty line, an actuarial value of at least 87 percent.
"(4) COORDINATION WITH PREMIUM TAX CREDITS.—The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall coordinate with the Secretary of the Treasury to ensure that the enhanced cost-sharing reductions under this subsection are appropriately integrated with the premium tax credits under section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.".

SEC. 5. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.
(a) ANNUAL REPORT.—Not later than March 1 of each year, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, shall submit to Congress a report on—
(1) the number of individuals receiving premium tax credits under section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986;
(2) the number of individuals receiving cost-sharing reductions under section 18071 of title 42, United States Code;
(3) the average amount of premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions provided; and
(4) recommendations for improving health insurance affordability.

SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE.
(a) PREMIUM TAX CREDIT AMENDMENTS.—The amendments made by section 3 shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2026.
(b) COST-SHARING REDUCTION AMENDMENTS.—The amendments made by section 4 shall apply to plan years beginning after December 31, 2026.
